title: Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted by Hyderabad court in hate speech cases - The News Minute
content:
1. Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted by Hyderabad court in hate speech cases  The News Minute
  2. AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted in decade-old hate speech cases  India Today
  3. Special Court Acquits Asaduddin Owaisi's Brother Akbaruddin Owaisi in Hate Speech Cases  Republic World
  4. AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted in hate speech cases  The Indian Express
  5. AIMIM's Akbaruddin Owaisi Acquitted In Two Hate Speech Cases From 2012  NDTV
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: A special court in Hyderabad on Wednesday, April 13, found All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul-Muslimeen (AIMIM) legislator Akbaruddin Owaisi not guilty in hate speech cases registered against him in 2012 including one over his now infamous comment about "removing the police for 15 minutes off the streets." The court was hearing a plea that clubbed multiple cases registered against Akbaruddin, the younger brother of Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi, for alleged hate speeches delivered by him in Nizamabad on December 8, 2012 and at Nirmal town on December 22, 2012.
